{"step_by_step_thinking": "Levetiracetam, Phenytoin, and Ethosuximide are anticonvulsants that do not typically cause visual field contraction. However, Vigabatrin is known to cause this side effect in some patients. It can cause a peripheral visual field defect, which is a form of visual field contraction.", "answer_choice": "C. Vigabatrin"}
